intro: Amethystanthus longitubus var. albiflorus, commonly known as the white-flowered amethystanthus, is a striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its elongated, tubular flowers that are predominantly white, contrasting with the typical purple hues of the species. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a sought-after plant among horticulturists and botanists.
